result.execSummary:
The defendant Giovanni A Cordero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: It is the court's intention that the Department of Corrections can take 25% from all money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. No contact, directly or indirectly, with the victims, person, property, residence or family. No contact with the victim stores. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Giovanni A Cordero in court with attorney Katie Lynn Gutowski.  Defendant Giovanni A Cordero in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates the most the family can post on each file is $1000.00 and family asks that the Court allow that amount of cash plus co-signature bond in an amount set by the Court. The State believes substantial cash is appropriate and warranted in these cases. The State believes no less than $10,000.00 cash on each file is appropriate.

BTC: Bond modification is granted. Modify bond to $15,000.00 cash on each case. Same conditions as previously ordered remain
